text: Dee Hartford (born Donna Higgins; April 21, 1928) is a retired American actress and model. She worked as a model for Vogue in the late 1940s. She is known for her acting roles in A Girl in Every Port, Red Line 7000, Perry Mason, The Twilight Zone, Gunsmoke, Burke's Law, The Outer Limits, The Alfred Hitchcock Hour, Batman, Time Tunnel, Land of the Giants and Lost in Space. Hartford was born in Salt Lake City, Utah. Her sister, actress Eden Hartford, was married to Groucho Marx. Hartford was married to movie director Howard Marks from 1953 to 1959. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Salt Lake City, Utah Category:Models from Utah Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors
title: Dee Hartford
